intro: Senecio harleyi, commonly known as the Harley's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Senecio harleyi is generally drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy plant suited to xeriscaping.
